sentences.sentence: King Thrushbeard
A king had a daughter who was very beautiful, but so proud and rude( 无礼的 ) that she thought none of the men who wanted to marry her were good enough for her.
She not only refused them all, but laughed at them in public as well.
Once the King gave a great feast( 宴会 ), and invited all the marriageable( 适婚的 ) men to it from far and near.

They were all put in rows, according to( 根据 )
 their status( 地位 ); first came the kings, then the princes( 王子 ), the dukes( 公爵 ), the earls( 伯爵 ), the barons( 男爵 ), and lastly the noblemen( 贵族 ).
The Princess( 公主 ) was led in front of the rows, but she had something bad to say about all of them.
One was too fat, another too thin.
One was too tall, another too short.
One was too red-faced, another too pale.
There was one particular king who was very tall, and whose chin( 下巴 ) was a little pointed( 尖的 ), whom she especially liked to make fun of( 嘲笑 ).
“Look,” cried she, laughing, “he has a chin like a thrush’s beak( （鸟类的）嘴，喙 ).”
And from that time on, everyone called him King Thrushbeard.

But the old King, when he saw that his daughter despised( 蔑视 ) all men and would not marry anyone, swore( 发誓 ) in his anger that he would marry her to the first unmarried man who came to the court and who wanted her.
A few days after that, a beggar( 乞丐 ) came to the court who lived by singing songs in exchange( 交换 ) for coins.
When the King heard of it, he invited the beggar in and asked him to sing.
And so the beggar came in in his torn( 破破烂烂的 ), dirty clothes, and sang before the King and his daughter.
When he had finished, he asked for a small reward( 报酬 ). But the King said,
“Your song has pleased me so much, that I will give you my daughter to marry.”
The Princess was horrified( 非常震惊的 ), but the king said,
“I swore to give you to the first unmarried man that came to court, and so it must be done.”
There was nothing she could do about it—because at that time, it was a father’s job to choose whom his daughter should marry.
The priest( 牧师 ) was called, and she had to be married to the beggar then and there.
When all was done, the King said, “Now, since you are a beggar’s wife, you can no longer stay in my castle( 城堡 ). So go away, and take your husband with you.”
The beggar led her away, and she had to go with him on foot.
On the way they came to a great wood, and she asked,
Whose is this wide wood, so thick and so great?
He answered,
The wood is King Thrushbeard’s, so thick and so great:
It might have been yours, only now it’s too late!
And she replied,
Somehow I seem to have ruined( 毁掉 ) my life:
Oh, how I now wish I were Thrushbeard’s wife!
Then they passed through an area of rich and well-kept farms, and she asked,
Oh, whose is this farmland( 农田 ), so green and so great?
He answered,
These farms are King Thrushbeard’s, so fertile( 肥沃的 ) and great:
They might have been yours, only now it’s too late!
And she replied,
Somehow I seem to have ruined my life:
Oh, how I now wish I were Thrushbeard’s wife!
Then they passed through a great city, and she asked,
Whose is this city, so rich and so great?
He answered,
This city’s King Thrushbeard’s, so rich and so great:
It might have been yours, only now it’s too late!
And she again replied,
Somehow I seem to have ruined my life:
Oh, how I now wish I were Thrushbeard’s wife!
Then the beggar said,
“It makes me angry to hear you always wishing for another husband. Am I not good enough for you?”

article_info.previous: 城堡里的“牛鬼蛇神”都没有吓到男孩。国王认为男孩睿智英勇，遵守承诺，把公主嫁给了男孩，但是男孩仍然被如何才能“被吓到”所困扰。于是公主趁驸马睡着把鱼倒在他身上，驸马终于害怕了。

question.cn: 宴会上的座位是怎么安排的？
question.en: How were the seats arranged at the royal party?

analysis: 文中提到：“They were all put in rows, according to their status; first came the kings, then the princes, the dukes, the earls, the barons, and lastly the noblemen.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 当公主得知国王要把她嫁给一个乞丐时是何感受？
question.en: How did the Princess feel when she knew that the King would marry off her to a beggar？

analysis: 文中提到：“Your song has pleased me so much, that I will give you my daughter to marry.” The Princess was horrified.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 当乞丐听到公主的“愿望”时，是何感受？
question.en: How did the beggar feel when he heard about the Princess’s “wishes”?

analysis: 由原文可知，当公主一次次提到希望自己是King Thrushbeard的妻子时，他的反应是这样的：“It makes me angry to hear you always wishing for another husband. Am I not good enough for you?” 因此答案选A。
